Palace threat over <lname>Cantona</lname> masks

Manchester United fans wearing <name>Eric Cantona</name> masks will not be allowed in Selhurst Park on Saturday.

United fans are planning to mark the 10th anniversary of <lname>Cantona</lname>'s infamous kung-fu kick on Crystal Palace fan <name>Matthew Simmons</name> by wearing the masks. But Palace stadium manager <name>Kevin Corner</name> has warned: "If they wear them inside Selhurst Park they will be immediately rejected on safety grounds. "And no fans wearing <lname>Cantona</lname> masks will be allowed entry to the stadium." United fans had declared Saturday as '<name>Cantona</name> Day' and had planned to wear masks, that were popular during the Frenchman's time as a player at the Old Trafford club. <lname>Cantona</lname> received a nine-month ban following the incident and Palace are keen to avoid an incident that would stir up ill feeling between the two sets of supporters. Four months after the <lname>Cantona</lname> incident a Palace fan, <name>Paul Nixon</name>, was killed prior to an FA Cup semi-final at Villa Park.
